name: Kairic Acolytes
description: These masked warriors are bound by sinister pacts to serve might Tzeentch. In the battle they make use of gifts of magic bestowed by their dark master.

abilities.name: Mighty Blast
abilities.description: If the attack roll for a Sorcerous Bolt is 6, its Damage is doubled.

abilities.name: Kairic Adept
abilities.description: This Acolyte's Sorcerous Bolts have Damage of 2 rather than 1.

abilities.name: Acolyte with Shield
abilities.description: This Acolyte has a Vigour of 4 rather than 3.

abilities.name: Acolyte with Glaive
abilities.description: This Acolyte's Cursed Blade has a Damage of 2 rather than 1.

abilities.name: Acolyte with Two Blades
abilities.description: Roll 4 dice for this Acolyte's Cursed Blade rather than 2.

abilities.name: Scroll of Dark Arts
abilities.description: Roll 2 dice for this Acolyte's Sorcerous Bolts.

abilities.name: Vulcharc
abilities.description: If an Acolyte with a Vulcharc is on the board, subtract 1 from all rolls on their behaviour table (to a minimum of 1), and re-roll rolls of 1 for the number of Kairic Acolytes summoned by Draw Their Blood.

difficultyBonuses.description: Instead of +1 to Vigour, subtract -1 to all Behaviour Rolls made for Kairic Acolytes groups.

table.name: Draw Their Blood
table.description: Each Acolyte moves and then attacks with whichever weapon is in range. After all of the Acolytes in the group have taken a turn, roll a dice and add 1 to the result for each wound they caused. On a 6 or more, set up a Pink Horror or D3 Kairic Acolytes in the same manner as an ambush, but do not roll for surprise. A Pink Horror will act in this phase unless Pink Horrors have already acted.

table.name: Slay the Unbelievers
table.description: Each Acolyte attacks the nearest hero with whichever weapon is in range. Then, each Acolyte that did not attack moves towards the nearest hero.

table.name: There is No Escape
table.description: Each Acolyte moves towards the nearest hero. Then, each Acolyte attacks the nearest hero with whichever weapon is in range.

table.name: Fall Back
table.description: If there are twice as many heroes on the board as Acolytes, each Acolyte move towards the nearest portal. An Acolyte that ends its move on a portal flees and is removed from play. Each Acolyte still on the board then attacks the nearest hero with whichever weapon is in range.
